0.content:
[Translate as part of a Yugioh card like description. Be as consice, short, and as accurate as possible. Replace the Chinese text with the English translation.

The elements a card can be (EG: Water, Fire Dark etc) is called "Attribute"
The type a card (EG: Rouge, Warrior, Hunter etc) is called "Type".
Attributes and Types are always capitalized. EG: "Hunter Type" or "Fire Attribute".
Removing or destorying a card from the game is called "banishing" a card.
The discard pile is called the "Graveyard". This word should be capitalized.
Statuses are labeled as [Status Name (X)] where X is the effect number if any.

Effects are marked as [X] where X is the effect number. The description must be after this number.
Effects that depend on the number must be descripted as X, and then defining what X is equal to.
EG: "[1]. Select a character on the field. Increase that character's attack power by 400 x X (X = the number of cards equipped)."
If a trap/ability card has an activation condition, the description must with "If..."
If a chararacter or equipment card has an activation condition, the description must start with "When..."
Avoid the use of "its". Use "this card" instead.
Preserve "\n" if present.
Replace「」with [].
Preserve anything contained in {}, incuding the {} themsleves.
Don't say "you can", say "you may"
Don't say "cannot", say "may not"
Avoid saying the phrase, "to activate"
Destory -> Banish
Replace ',' in a translation with ';' THIS IS VERY IMPORTANT
Include all Japanese text in the output from the input THIS IS VERY IMPORTANT. 

Example Input:
ブレイドダンス,刀剑乱舞
[1].ランダムな相手モンスターに300ポイントのダメージを与える。これを墓地の装備カードの数だけ繰り返す。,[1]. 对随机一只对手怪兽造成 300 点伤害。 对墓地中装备的卡牌数量重复此操作。

Example Output:
ブレイドダンス,Blade Dance
[1].ランダムな相手モンスターに300ポイントのダメージを与える。これを墓地の装備カードの数だけ繰り返す。,[1]. Inflict 300 x X damage to a random opponent's monster. (X = The number of equipment cards in your Graveyard.)
]

5.content: [In your next reply, your output must follow: {original sentence},{translated sentence} as intended in a comma delimited csv. Translate line by line. DO NOT wrap anything in "". /n does not mean new line. Escape any non delimiter "," by replacing it with ";". Do not end a line with ","]

6.content:
When translating Japanes to English, note the following forms:
して -> te form means the word must end with "ing"
ちゃった -> this form means something "ended up as" or "gone and went without permission"
まま -> while, all while
ほらほらほら -> replace with spicy adjectives filled sexy description based on sentence context.
ほら -> (used to draw the listers attention to something, replace with spicy English equivalent or translate as "hora")
かしら -> "I wonder/perhaps" (feminine)
じゃない？-> "don't you think?/aren't they?/if it isnt that?"
でしょう -> "right?/you know?" (Promping listener for their opinion or thoughts)
あら -> Oh?/What's this?
シコシコ -> Replace with a sexy description of a cock being stroked/massaged for a subby male.
のに -> and yet/even though
あげる -> I'll do (for you)

Japanese sfx:
When translating Japanese sfx, there is no faithful equivalent, so be creative and describe the word using vivid and explicit English adjectives in the translated version of the sentence while being as lewd as possible

Topic:
Japan sentences have no topic, but English sentences do. If not sentences topic exists, use information around the sentences to determine what the topic is in a natural way. Always include the topic at the start of the sentence if applicable. Eg 挟んで usually refers to wrapping around a dick. Something soft might refer to the speakers boobs etc.

Sentences order:
Remember to re order the translated sentence in English, verbs come last in Japanese but in English they need to be first. Typically an English sentence should be translated in the opposite order of the Japanese sentence. 

Plurals:
Japanese has no plurals, so make sure to distinguish if there is one or many of something when translating a noun into English.

Sentence enders:
ね -> the speaker is saying the sentence with a smile/asking for approval
よ -> the speaker is emphasizing their sentence. Usually this means a ! In English.
